sponsor.translation[0].definitions[0].de: a person or company that pays for a show, broadcast, sports event etc, especially in exchange for the right to advertise at that event
sponsor.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: Eastman Kodak is a major sponsor of the Olympics.
sponsor.translation[0].definitions[1].de: a person or company that supports someone by paying for their training, education, living costs etc
sponsor.translation[0].definitions[2].de: someone who agrees to give someone else money for a charity if they walk, run etc a particular distance
sponsor.translation[0].definitions[3].de: someone who officially introduces or supports a proposal for a new law
sponsor.translation[0].definitions[4].de: someone who officially agrees to help someone else, or to be responsible for what they do
sponsor.translation[0].definitions[4].ex: You cannot get a work visa without an American sponsor.
sponsor.translation[1].definitions[0].de: to give money to a sports event, theatre, institution etc, especially in exchange for the right to advertise
sponsor.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: The competition was sponsored by British Airways.
sponsor.translation[1].definitions[1].de: to support someone by paying for their training, education, living costs etc
sponsor.translation[1].definitions[1].ex: The bank had offered to sponsor him at university.
sponsor.translation[1].definitions[2].de: to officially support a proposal for a new law
sponsor.translation[1].definitions[3].de: to agree to help someone or be responsible for what they do
sponsor.translation[1].definitions[4].de: to agree to give someone money for charity if they walk, run etc a particular distance
sponsor.translation[2].definitions[0].de: to give money to pay for a television programme, a sports or arts event, training etc, in exchange for advertising or to get public attention
